answerText: Phèdre[10] Jean Racine, the author of Phèdre, strictly observed the unities of action, time, and place rather dubiously derived from this Greek author's Poetics.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 10 | 5 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: A character in this play laments, "The gods have robbed me of an innocent life," before being dragged by his horses' reins to a watery death. For 10 points each: [10] Name this play about a manipulative queen of Athens who lusts after her stepson Hippolytus.
